text: The "stopwatch" functionality is now working. Basically, at the end of every AutoMerge job (PR, schedule/cron, or workflow_dispatch), we start a 20-minute timer. At the end of those 20 minutes, we use the GitHub Actions API to check to see when the last schedule/cron or workflow_dispatch job; if it was more than 15 minutes ago, we use the GitHub Actions API (authenticating with a personal access token) to trigger a new workflow_dispatch job.

text:
In the long run, wouldn't it be even more reliable to have a per-PR-auto-merge? So that once the X min are over, assuming everything is green/unblocked, that particular PR is merged.

Then use the current cron job for non-JuliaRegistrator PRs only, perhaps at reduced frequency.
